values.description:
Adds a couple of script that allow direct joint control of arms with a Korg nanoKontrol USB mixer.  There's much more to do in this direction, but this is a working and potentially useful start.

To try it out:

    roslaunch atlas_utils atlas.launch &
    rosrun atlas_utils nanokontrol.py 3 &
    rosrun atlas_utils arm_teleop.py l

The argument to `nanokontrol.py` is a MIDI device address; the right value might be different for your machine.

The argument to `arm_teleop.py` can be `l` to control the left arm, `r` for the right, or `lr` for both (a kind of naive mirroring).

To prevent the robot from falling over as you teleop the arms, you might want to pin it first:

    rostopic pub --once /atlas/mode std_msgs/String '{ data: pinned }'
values.title: Add direct joint teleop scripts using USB mixer

summary.raw:
Adds a couple of script that allow direct joint control of arms with a Korg nanoKontrol USB mixer.  There's much more to do in this direction, but this is a working and potentially useful start.

To try it out:

    roslaunch atlas_utils atlas.launch &
    rosrun atlas_utils nanokontrol.py 3 &
    rosrun atlas_utils arm_teleop.py l

The argument to `nanokontrol.py` is a MIDI device address; the right value might be different for your machine.

The argument to `arm_teleop.py` can be `l` to control the left arm, `r` for the right, or `lr` for both (a kind of naive mirroring).

To prevent the robot from falling over as you teleop the arms, you might want to pin it first:

    rostopic pub --once /atlas/mode std_msgs/String '{ data: pinned }'
summary.html:
Adds a couple of script that allow direct joint control of arms with a Korg nanoKontrol USB mixer. There's much more to do in this direction, but this is a working and potentially useful start.

To try it out:

roslaunch atlas_utils atlas.launch &
rosrun atlas_utils nanokontrol.py 3 &
rosrun atlas_utils arm_teleop.py l

The argument to nanokontrol.py is a MIDI device address; the right value might be different for your machine.

The argument to arm_teleop.py can be l to control the left arm, r for the right, or lr for both (a kind of naive mirroring).

To prevent the robot from falling over as you teleop the arms, you might want to pin it first:

rostopic pub --once /atlas/mode std_msgs/String '{ data: pinned }'

values.description:
To try it (you need sandia_hand/ slider_grasp_control from source):

    roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch &
    roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_arm_slider_teleop.launch

Then hit the SCENE button at least once (otherwise the button state is incorrectly initialized).  SCENE 1 gives you per-joint control of the arms.  SCENE 2 gives you simple eigengrasp control.  For grasp control, see #!/osrf/sandia-hand/pull-request/13/
values.title: Combine arm and grasp teleop

summary.raw:
To try it (you need sandia_hand/ slider_grasp_control from source):

    roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch &
    roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_arm_slider_teleop.launch

Then hit the SCENE button at least once (otherwise the button state is incorrectly initialized).  SCENE 1 gives you per-joint control of the arms.  SCENE 2 gives you simple eigengrasp control.  For grasp control, see #!/osrf/sandia-hand/pull-request/13/
summary.html:
To try it (you need sandia_hand/ slider_grasp_control from source):

roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch &
roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_arm_slider_teleop.launch

Then hit the SCENE button at least once (otherwise the button state is incorrectly initialized). SCENE 1 gives you per-joint control of the arms. SCENE 2 gives you simple eigengrasp control. For grasp control, see #!/osrf/sandia-hand/pull-request/13/

values.description:
added ros topic `/multisense_sl/fps` for changing camera update rate.

currently, the resolution is locked to 1024 X 544 @ 1 - 60Hz.

change foot friction to 0.9 until further validation results are available.

per [question](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/1511/the-question-about-the-contact-sensor-data/) removed filter on feet contact force torque outputs.
values.title: unthrottle ros controller update rates for the multicamera to prevent mismatch between gazebo image rates and ros image publish rates.

summary.raw:
added ros topic `/multisense_sl/fps` for changing camera update rate.

currently, the resolution is locked to 1024 X 544 @ 1 - 60Hz.

change foot friction to 0.9 until further validation results are available.

per [question](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/1511/the-question-about-the-contact-sensor-data/) removed filter on feet contact force torque outputs.
summary.html:
added ros topic /multisense_sl/fps for changing camera update rate.

currently, the resolution is locked to 1024 X 544 @ 1 - 60Hz.

change foot friction to 0.9 until further validation results are available.

per question removed filter on feet contact force torque outputs.

values.description:
Currently, all the links will be teleported to the same location if a quaternion with all zero elements is specified. This fix normalizes the quaternions.

To test:

`roslaunch atlas_utils atlas.launch`

and

`rostopic pub /atlas/set_pose --once 'geometry_msgs/Pose' '{position: {z: 0.95}}'`
values.title: Normalize quaternions in pose message for atlas/set_pose topic

summary.raw:
Currently, all the links will be teleported to the same location if a quaternion with all zero elements is specified. This fix normalizes the quaternions.

To test:

`roslaunch atlas_utils atlas.launch`

and

`rostopic pub /atlas/set_pose --once 'geometry_msgs/Pose' '{position: {z: 0.95}}'`
summary.html:
Currently, all the links will be teleported to the same location if a quaternion with all zero elements is specified. This fix normalizes the quaternions.

To test:

roslaunch atlas_utils atlas.launch

and

rostopic pub /atlas/set_pose --once 'geometry_msgs/Pose' '{position: {z: 0.95}}'

values.description:
Merged pull request #135, pull request #136 


 * initial 5 steps demo
 * add `/atlas/control_mode` control for walking controller.
 * add `atlas_AtlasSimInterface.world` with time step adjusted for debugging.
 * added "harnessed" mode for `/atlas/mode` to up-right the robot automatically for debugging.
 * add helper functions in `AtlasPlugin` to zero pid gains or load pid gains from ros param server.
 * split talus and foot inertia equally between the two links.
values.title: Add AtlasSimInterface library

summary.raw:
Merged pull request #135, pull request #136 


 * initial 5 steps demo
 * add `/atlas/control_mode` control for walking controller.
 * add `atlas_AtlasSimInterface.world` with time step adjusted for debugging.
 * added "harnessed" mode for `/atlas/mode` to up-right the robot automatically for debugging.
 * add helper functions in `AtlasPlugin` to zero pid gains or load pid gains from ros param server.
 * split talus and foot inertia equally between the two links.
summary.html:
Merged pull request #135, pull request #136

  • initial 5 steps demo
  • add /atlas/control_mode control for walking controller.
  • add atlas_AtlasSimInterface.world with time step adjusted for debugging.
  • added "harnessed" mode for /atlas/mode to up-right the robot automatically for debugging.
  • add helper functions in AtlasPlugin to zero pid gains or load pid gains from ros param server.
  • split talus and foot inertia equally between the two links.

values.description:
Contributing a tool/tutorial for controlling the atlas via joint commands.

The tool is a combination of the ROS joint state publisher:

http://www.ros.org/wiki/joint_state_publisher

(which publishes sensor_msgs/JointState messages)

And the python Atlas tutorial:
http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/2.0/Atlas_control_over_ROS_topics_with_python

It populates a list of joint angles, then with scrollbars allows them to be set and then published as a osrf_msgs::JointCommand message.

... so the user can change individual joints and see the output from gazebo.

Could this be added to the list of tutorials and maintained. (My previous version of this was broken when the API changed)
http://people.csail.mit.edu/mfallon/share/2013feb/joint_gui/joint_command_gui.png
values.title: added joint_command_gui tool - not sure where it should live

It populates a list of joint angles, then with scrollbars allows them to be set and then published as a osrf_msgs::JointCommand message.

... so the user can change individual joints and see the output from gazebo.

Could this be added to the list of tutorials and maintained. (My previous version of this was broken when the API changed)

Contributing a tool/tutorial for controlling the atlas via joint commands.

The tool is a combination of the ROS joint state publisher:

http://www.ros.org/wiki/joint_state_publisher

(which publishes sensor_msgs/JointState messages)

And the python Atlas tutorial: http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/2.0/Atlas_control_over_ROS_topics_with_python

It populates a list of joint angles, then with scrollbars allows them to be set and then published as a osrf_msgs::JointCommand message.

... so the user can change individual joints and see the output from gazebo.

Could this be added to the list of tutorials and maintained. (My previous version of this was broken when the API changed) http://people.csail.mit.edu/mfallon/share/2013feb/joint_gui/joint_command_gui.png

values.description:
This pull requests adds the gazebo_ros_force plugin to enable to apply forces (perturbations) to the robot's pelvis. 

This adds the plugin to get compiled as well as adds to the atlas.gazebo urdf file to load the plugin to enable forces to the pelvis.
values.title: Added gazebo_ros_force plugin

summary.raw:
This pull requests adds the gazebo_ros_force plugin to enable to apply forces (perturbations) to the robot's pelvis. 

This adds the plugin to get compiled as well as adds to the atlas.gazebo urdf file to load the plugin to enable forces to the pelvis.
summary.html:
This pull requests adds the gazebo_ros_force plugin to enable to apply forces (perturbations) to the robot's pelvis.

This adds the plugin to get compiled as well as adds to the atlas.gazebo urdf file to load the plugin to enable forces to the pelvis.

values.description:
This pull request includes several fixes to the DRC Vehicle controller plugin. It fixes some math errors, and controller bugs that caused the vehicle to drift instead of remaining stationary and to stop frequently while turning (issues #103, #109, #116).

I increased the stiffness of the gas and brake pedals and reduced the stiffness of the steering wheel. There is a separate [pull request for a change to the polaris model](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/22).
values.title: Vehicle plugin updates, fix for #103, #109, #116

summary.raw:
This pull request includes several fixes to the DRC Vehicle controller plugin. It fixes some math errors, and controller bugs that caused the vehicle to drift instead of remaining stationary and to stop frequently while turning (issues #103, #109, #116).

I increased the stiffness of the gas and brake pedals and reduced the stiffness of the steering wheel. There is a separate [pull request for a change to the polaris model](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/22).
summary.html:
This pull request includes several fixes to the DRC Vehicle controller plugin. It fixes some math errors, and controller bugs that caused the vehicle to drift instead of remaining stationary and to stop frequently while turning (issues #103, #109, #116).

I increased the stiffness of the gas and brake pedals and reduced the stiffness of the steering wheel. There is a separate pull request for a change to the polaris model.

values.description:
The atlas_golf_cart_fire_hose.launch and drc_sim_v0.launch files were not importing the atlas_description.

Also, the renaming of the stepping_block manifest in pull request #150 was targeted at drcsim_2.1 but didn't get into 2.2, so I've included it here as well.
values.title: Fix launch files, rename model manifest

summary.raw:
The atlas_golf_cart_fire_hose.launch and drc_sim_v0.launch files were not importing the atlas_description.

Also, the renaming of the stepping_block manifest in pull request #150 was targeted at drcsim_2.1 but didn't get into 2.2, so I've included it here as well.
summary.html:
The atlas_golf_cart_fire_hose.launch and drc_sim_v0.launch files were not importing the atlas_description.

Also, the renaming of the stepping_block manifest in pull request #150 was targeted at drcsim_2.1 but didn't get into 2.2, so I've included it here as well.
